comments.commentBody:
Don't forget "foreign military aid" as, for instance, where we give Pakistan $1.5 billion per year with the stipulation that it be used to buy weaponry from US manufactures (and it doesn't show up in the military appropriation account).

If the wall is a defensive measure, its cost could be defrayed by designating it "military assistance" to Mexico, and many Mexicans could find employment building it. That could be tempting for Mexico. And, some Trump proxy could get the management contract.

Hi JD , this business of I'll build a wall and you'll pay for it is classic New York landlord speak as in "I'll replace your 30 year old refrigerator and you'll pay me every month for it and it's mine when you leave". A lot of where Trump's deal making was learned from "negotiating" with tenants over whom he has a huge amount of leverage. Like most New York City landlords, Trump is a jerk.

To JD , this is such a good comment , I feel exactly as you do, and the end was particularly profound. The incivility is almost too much to
process. This man, Trump is pure evil , and it's scary how many people are supporting him , who giggle , laugh , and cheer at his vicious comments .

Exactly what value system can somebody be said to have when they insist that they want to build something for their own interests, but will make you pay for it? On this same line of thought, why don't I just go over to my neighbor and tell them that they are paying for the in-ground pool that I want on my property? Because, as most of us learn at a very young age, if we want something, WE have to work for it. That means, if we want an 'A', if we want to run fast, if we want to get a raise, if we want to buy a new car, if we want to get a date, then WE are the ones who will have to work for it. The very notion that something that we want should be provided for us by others is a fundamental display of lassitude and an abdication of responsibility. I'm surprised that so many religious people support Trump, when he so consistently violates any semblance of morality -- lust, greed, wrath, pride, and now sloth in wishing to have others pick up the bill (i.e. do all the work) for something he wants to build. Truly, the longer this election goes on, the more I feel it is being proved to me that this society is not something I relate to in the least. I yearn for the times where, even if morals were not upheld by all people, at the very least, they were held high as ideals and aspired to. To see people so abandon any sense of goodness is a strike at the core of the human spirit which leaves me too disheartened to explain.
Not when he loses the presidential election in a landslide!

I'm a bit surprised by the knee-jerk reactions of commenters who seem to suggest "I wasn't there....so I'm in the clear".

I wasn't there when slavery happened either, but it's important to understand the full history of a place out of basic respect for those humans who came before us.

Many Americans rightfully recognize America's wretched role in the horrid mistreatment of African Americans and Native Americans in history, but many Americans flippantly whitewash those dark chapters into a 'no big deal' folder and file it in a mental shredder and can't seem to grasp why we can't just 'move on', thereby adding horrible insult to horrible injury while being oblivious to their callous indifference to racial reality.

I am white....but I don't think the average American white person tries to understand what it's like to have black skin or Native American skin in a white man's America that has always been tilted socially, economically, academically and judicially in his favor for 400 years.

America was built on Native American genocide and Indian reservation segregation.

America was built on hundreds of years of barbaric slavery, systematic segregation, Jim Crow, 'red-lining' and vitriolic racism championed by the Fake Bible Belt that still breathes racial poison today.

The White Wonder Bread history frequently taught in America is an insult to honesty, history and humanity.

All Americans have a burning duty to the harsh historical truth and an honest reconciliation thereof.
The bottom line is that Trump wimped out on who pays for the wall.  In his own words, Trump is a loser.

I suppose it depends who is saying it and how it is said.  An idea of keeping a national border is perfectly reasonable.  But when a village idiot says I am keeping the place safe by building a wall paid for by the fairy Godmother, you begin to discount anything that's coming out of that village idiot.
So Trumps actions and words over the past year are forgotten with a photo op in Mexico? No thanks.

Your comment on "common ideals" is fine and dandy, but when push comes to shove, these ideals are totally different for White people and Black People.

Police killing black people, the lead poisoning in Detroit, some southern states trying to make it harder for Black people to vote, are just 3 examples that come to mind of the inequality in the USA.

As for Mr. Kaepernick's "little act", it seems to have got the attention of all the newspapers, but the same newspapers have forgotten the follow-up news reporting on all of the Black killings by police this past summer. So much for "common ideals"!

"Many people are saying we talked about it. I don't know, you tell me. We talked about many, many things and we're going to do very very good things. The Mexicans love me, believe me. I'm yuge over there."
Trump, I understand.  What was Nieto thinking?  DUH!

Netanyahu?

Probably not.
Justin Trudeau
Maybe, given his vitriol, the secret service has told him they cannot guarantee his safety abroad.  One has to wonder.  Given how much he is detested around the world, with a few exceptions.

Is there a leader of another country who has the courage to refuse to meet with Donald Trump, whether Trump is the Republican nominee or not?  The only such person I can think of is Sadiq Khan, the mayor of London, but there has to be someone else with enough courage to refuse to give this bully the air of authenticity he thinks he can buy.
Clinton did well to stay out of this charade.  She cannot by herself prevent the emergence of neo-fascism in America.

You got that exactly right except for the part of educated readers.  There are many educated people that are supporting Trump.  They are just not to saying it publicly to mess with the heads of the pollsters.
Clinton blew it by not staging a contrived photo-op in Mexico?

Trump's biggest weakness is his inability to come across as a credible President. While many educated readers will conclude his visit to Mexico doesn't change that, many voters will conclude that it does. I predict a noticeable jump in his poll numbers. Clinton really blew this one.
Why aren't we hearing about the Clintons Foundation's donations to African-American causes? Are there any?
Phil,you're wrong. Google Trumps remarks on June 16 2015.
Uh, whose accounts would those be, exactly? Anybody past puberty?
Yes, bring a witness. And count your fingers after shaking his really yuuuge hand.

This was a chance for President Nieto to politely but firmly put Trump in his place. After all of Trump's horrid rhetoric about Mexico and its citizens, Nieto was well within his rights to take Trump to task.

That he didn't disappoints me and, I'm sure, most of Mexico.

Internet Troll is right!

That's what they call people who use Twitter and just spout crazy talk and lies and insults.

Back in the 1960's or 1970's, I used to have one of those tiny dolls they called trolls. It had wild orange hair, and come to think of it, it did sort of look like Trump....

The simple explanation is that Trump does not in any way represents the US.  It would have been more appropriate to have displayed the marquee to the Trump Taj Mahal rather than the Stars and Stripes.
I assume that is because Trump does not represent the U.S. government.

With modern technology it is possible to clean up all the contamination. I think they spent $1.1 billion. They plan to build 10,500 housing units there.

http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Neighbors-get-look-at-Hunters-Poin...

Agree.  With roof/room and fusty/musty as options for the very first two A's, the theme was clear to me long before I reached the reveal.  My older daughter's college housing is gender-inclusive (formerly known as gender-neutral), so this was all well within my wheelhouse.

In the case of this puzzle, the reveal actually aided in the solve more than usual. I started out thinking, "Part of a house...well, it could be a lot of things." I got some letters, and thought, "Could be ROOM, could be ROOF, let's wait." Then, I saw the down clue, and MAKE came to mind first, so it was ROOM for the time being.

A few minutes later, I had GENDER-----, and the only five-letter word I could think of that ends that phrase is FLUID. I checked a couple of the crosses, and decided: a) that was indeed the end of the entry, and b) it's ROOM AND ROOF.

After that, it was just enough to look out for a possible F or M, and remember to put both of them.

What seemed like it was going to take forever whittled down to just over 10 minutes for me.
M S - Exactly! Thank you.
I wonder how many people were genuinely surprised when Mexico declined to help pay for Trump's wall?!

.
I truly miss JFC tonight. His avatar would have been ICONic, and he may have been helpful on this issue.

As the MTF of the group (which apparently for this puzzle would mean something not altogether congruent with what it means to me), I will say to use M in all those squares. Or F. I used M because I choose to identify as such for GENDER purposes. You may use F. The answers you tried are more FLUID.

As a longtime successful solver (regardless of what the software thinks), I'll say that no streak matters, except insofar as it is a burden because people get a bit caught up in issues such as how to enter the rebii successfully. Hence, I sometimes stop my own streak by hitting Check on a letter I know to be right. My supposed streak is now somewhere in the TEENs. So what. Another Commenter claims to have one of more than 300 days. So what.

But I recommend using a single letter this time. Never forget that if your browser happens to crash before the website registers that you completed the puzzle on time and successfully, you will see a blue star instead of a gold one, and your streak will end. You must then contact the excellent Customer Care people to remedy this. As you may have guessed, I did not contact them when it happened to me.

Oh, 2 more things.

1. It's not a "winning" streak, although Donald Trump may say so. He thinks "winning" is what it's all about. It's a solving streak. He's not so good at solutions.

2. Deb wrote some lovely remarks. I hope you read them.

I struggled with this one and I'm sad to say I didn't ever understand that there could be two correct answers, even after I heard the little victory song. I was scratching my head as to which squares were the ones being referred to in the revealer, which itself stumped me over and over.  It didn't help that I had OVERDONE in place of OVERLONG for quite a while, until I twigged to (or just twigged?) the fact that "blowup" was descr. as an abbr.  It was a fine challenging puzzle and I enjoyed it. I just have to learn over and over to let my mind be flexible- -or should I say FLUID?
